Reviews.Title: “Short but excellent stay!!”
Reviews.Author: bangla_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for only one night and two days but enjoed a lot. Frist of all during the checking time we were upgrated!! Our room was on the 30th floor with a harbour view. The room decor was very nice and elegant. It is a year old hotel, so everything was very clean and modern.The room size was quite ok compare to other Hong Kong hotels. Our bed was king size and confortable.We had free unlimited Wifi which keeps me connected with my Facebook :)My daughter loved the Jacuzzi bathtub. Breakfast was included and surprisingly selection of foods were very good! Everything was very fresh and tasty!! Location wise it was little bit far from the central are but taxi fair is not expensive. Hotel has own shuttle bus service. Though we didnt get chance to use of it. There are 7-11 and Coffee shop close by. Definitely I will recommend this hotle to my friends and will be back again for longer stay. We stayed two days in another hotel but really missed Dorsett!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 stars worth”
Reviews.Author: forrestfern
Reviews.Content: We decided to try this hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor, and it turned to be the best decision! Checks-in was smooth, staff were helpful, interior was newly furnished, clean and tasteful. The room was not particularly big but nicely laid out, the color-theme made the room looks bigger than it is. Free WiFi is available throughout the building. The only thing needs improving is the selection of tv channels but we don't mind that very much as we didn't stay in the hotel all the time. In the morning we came down to the 3rd floor for breakfasts expecting a simple dimsum as it was mentioned in the review and were pleasantly surprised by the array of breakfast buffet: eggs station, fruits & salad bar, Asian cooked dishes, selections of bread & cereals .....worth a 5 stars rating! The breakfast room was not so big overlooking a nicely arranged sun lounges by the pool. A very nice, worth every penny experience! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with a great price”
Reviews.Author: keith s
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, I was surprised for the price. Clean and new and a good size. The bathroom was also a good size. Good linens but not top of the line, but good quality. The decor was bright and we got luck and had a partial view of the harbor. The only negative would be the location, made worse by the fact that not one taxi driver knows where this hotel is. Ask for a card at the front desk. Unfortunately the address is print in tiny type and everyone had a hard time reading it. I thought we were going to die when one driver tried to read it while driving and took out a magnifying glass. They do have a shuttle to/from the ferry terminal and the hong kong airport express. The pool is not open yet but looks small... this is a small hotel. If you want a big fancy lobby this is not for you. If you want a good size clean comfortable room for a good price this is it. Breakfast was also included and I had low expectation. The breakfast was good and even had a chef cooking eggs to order.

Reviews.Title: “Overall is good .”
Reviews.Author: helenwong324
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights this summer. The location of this hotel is very convenience which nearby Kwun Tong MTR station and the APM shopping mall. The front desk staff named Gary Lee provided a very excellent service, very efficiency and polite. He gave me a lot of information such as the shuttle bus timetable which is very useful for me. The decoration of the hotel lobby is very modern. I will recommend to all my friend who will come to HK. Thanks , Helen Wong

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value - Clean, well decorated, and great service”
Reviews.Author: Chanybean
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dorsett Regency Hotel for three nights at the beginning of August as part of my vacation to South East Asia. I read their positive reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. I arranged for the shuttle from the airport for 140 Hong Kong Dollars (about $18 USD). I had to wait about a half hour, but I was the only one on the shuttle so it was basically like getting a cab for the price of a shuttle. The hotel is super clean, well air conditioned, and nicely decorated. I had a single room, which was tiny, but I know that is pretty typical for Hong Kong. Inside my room, I had an Ipod dock, a desk, and real nice smelling shower ammenities. I didn't realize it the first night, but my room on the 10th floor (? I think), actually had a partial view of the water. One complaint I have about the room is that there is a window between the bathroom and the bedroom area. I know this is popular in hotels as I've seen it before, but I can not understand why. Breakfast was great with really good coffee and service. The desk staff was really helpful with suggestions of places to go. The only suggestion that was off was that they told me that I would be able to see the light show (at the Harbor) from Victoria Peak, which was only partially true. You could see some of the spotlights, but not enough of the show to appreciate it. The shuttle from the hotel was easy to use and, at least at 9 in the morning, was not filled up. I usually took it to the Airport Express station (10 minutes away) and easily caught the metro or walked to the Star Ferry to get to Kowloon or other Hong Kong attractions. It was a little trickier getting back to the hotel. Usually I got back to Hong Kong Island after the shuttle stopped running so I took cabs which were not that expensive. Most of the cabs had not heard of the hotel, but I handed them the card with the hotel address as well as driving directions that the hotel provided and was always able to get home without a problem. Given the location of the hotel, I don't think it would have been feasible to walk back home from the metro. But I did pass construction for a new Metro station, so eventually it seems that the hotel will be walking distance to the Metro. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. I think it is appropriately priced for the quality that you receive. Even though the hotel is a little far from the metro, given their shuttle service and the cheep price of a cab, this should not be a deterrent from choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: keechhidalgo
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our rooms which provided us with gorgeous views of the harbor, the city, and the mountains. And the showers were definitely great. The hotel staff we met during our stay were helpful and very efficient---the shuttle driver (we didn't get his name) was so punctual that we marveled at how he managed to be at the dropoff points at the exact time indicated in the shuttle schedule; front desk staff Alan (who handled our check-in) and Tom (who even went the extra mile by helping us with our e-boarding passes when we checked out) ; housekeeping staff Lean (who single-handedly wheeled in and installed the extra bed) and Cody (who always brought us our bucket of ice nightly); and the lobby personnel Alvin, Bobby, and Hilbert. In short, the service was impeccable. Dorsett Regency is our preferred address every time we're in Hong Kong. And with the opening of the new MTR line and its station just two blocks away from the hotel, it can only get better.

Reviews.Title: “Chic interior hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Zaics
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dorsett Regency Hotel for 4 nights, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It's great to start our day with a great breakfast with everything you would want, fruits, yogurt, fresh made omelettes, sausage, bacon, etc. The interior of the hotel was very unique, chic and clean. We especially liked the shower room, beautiful tile work and great massage shower. Overall, we were very happy with the service and the stay. The shuttle bus worked out great to the Central Station, and if you miss the shuttle bus, you can just take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Plumbing problems, lots of noise. Larger- then- average rooms, though.”
Reviews.Author: xerophytic
Reviews.Content: A mixed bag, in terms of quality: If you can sleep through anything, & like being in an out- of- the- way commercial side street, this place is a relative bargain.. Good value for large living quarters.. Lobby, though small, has cheerfully contemporary decor.. Room has many unexpectedly elegant touches.. Bathroom has stale, funky odor. No mini- fridge for perishables.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A3aan
Reviews.Content: Very, very, very attentive staff! Location was good, tram is 2 minutes walk and the hourly shuttle to MRT station and IFC/ Airport express is very convenient and reliable. Good coffee shop opposite hotel, 7-11 next to hotel and some good restaurants near by (in Davis street). Room was not very large, but acceptable. Nice design and clean. Some people are complaining about the breakfast. In our opinion it was good, Hong Kong is Asia so with that in mind the breakfast was more than okay. Croissants, brown bread, white bread, cerials, fruit, eggs (anyway you like) and of course English and Asian breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel located in an authentic chinese neighborhood !”
Reviews.Author: FabriceandJulie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in Hong Kong ! Excellent and thoughtful staff. Housekeepers were very nice, too. Room extremely clean with a very special view on the building in front of the window (we loved it, it was like in New York). Trendy bathroom very well-equiped (with all the things you need for the toilet : soap, cream, tooth pasta, shampoo, after shampoo, shower gel, etc.). Elegant and stylish decoration. Fantastic continental and chinese breakfast (different every day) with a big choice of cold and hot food and chinese dumplings (so good !). There's a little swimming pool outside but unfortunately closed during our stay. Yes, the hotel is a little remote from the centre but it was exactly what we were looking for : to stay in a real chinese neighborhood. And it's not a problem because there is a free shuttle to go in the centre of the city, every day. There also are buses and tramways nearby the hotel. In conclusion, this hotel was excellent, we really loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stay!”
Reviews.Author: KM0089
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 night stay here in July. Great hotel. Good choice at breakfast. Our room had a lovely view of the water. Some reviews have said the hotel is remote but there is a free shuttle service to hong kong station which is ideal. Would stay again if back in hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, great services, very content”
Reviews.Author: FrancisFarmer
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was highly rated on trip advisor and we got exactly what we were looking for - a room with a great view, very boutiquey trappings (minimalist design, blacks, whites, beiges, great sheets, comfy mattress, lots of pillows, large bathroom with a rainforest fitting, and a bay window looking over hong kong harbor), and great service. The place is a bit remote, but it's a 20 hkd cab ride in and the area around it has good local restaurants and the water is one (very small) block away. A bit weird that the hallways weren't air conditioned, but otherwise we were very content. Get the Deluxe room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice service. A bit remote.”
Reviews.Author: Prufrockster
Reviews.Content: The accommodation is good and affordable. Staff are fantastic. Hotel shuttle bus is great. But the hotel is not in the best of locations, some way out of central Hong Kong. Taxis in general in Hong Kong are very affordable, but just make sure you take a hotel route map with you. Most drivers had no idea where the hotel was. Reliable places to eat nearby were few.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service - 5 nights”
Reviews.Author: mb02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and l was really worried before arrival that it was not close to the MTR, there was no need to worry as all other reviews have said taxi's are a bargain and we constantly used the hotel shuttle it leaves hourly and picks up in a location that links to central. The breakfast was fantastic l am really going to miss dim sum each morning. The reception staff were fantastic. We asked them to call us a cab (it was peak hour) and assumed they would call one to the hotel no hilbert walked out onto a major road got one and rode it back to us before we hoped in. The staff wrote out where we wanted to go in cantonese at all times and it was a bargain to soho $40 HKD. The only fault would be room service sometimes we would be gone for 8 hours and our room was still not one day and one day they left us without toilet paper but all was quickly fixed. I was happy with the room size much bigger than some of the hotels we have stayed in Japan. We had 2706 and had harbour view which was nice. For the price we paid, this was a fantastic hotel and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: happy traveller from Finland
Reviews.Content: Reception: Our check-in and check-out process was very fast. Public areas: All areas were very clean and stylish. Room: Room was little bit small in my taste. But like public areas also room was very clean and stylish. Nice little detail was window from toilet / shower to the rest of room. There was motorized curtain to that window. Restaurant: We used restaurant only for the breakfast. That restaurant was also little bit too small in my taste. Variety of the food was very limited, but food quality and taste was very good. Transport: We had little bit problems to find hotel shuttle at Hong Kong train station because that shuttle bus was white and there was only little text where was hotel name. But when we got back to home hotel has got brand new shuttle bus and that was painted to hotel colours and name.

Reviews.Title: “6 night in Dorsett Regency”
Reviews.Author: haboba13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dorsett Regency for 6 nights. The rooms were spotless clean,the decor very modern and chic. We chose to saty in this hotel as it was away from the hustle and bustle of the city, the views we had from our room 2006 were not the best, high rise buildings and a week peak of the sea on the side. The Customer Service from Sam at the reception, Hilbert, and Tom were spot on. They were very very helpful, spoke fantastic english. The hotel provided us with breakfast, Mathew and Daisy made sure every one was well taken care of in the dining area. The breakfast area is very small and you have to wait for your turn to get a table. The hotel has a shuttle to that runs every hour to Central so no problem at all. I was slightly dissed that we had kids running outside our room, very early in the morning and till late at night. Maybe the hotel could accomadate all families with children on one floor so they do not disturb guests at 7am in the morning with thier shouting and running in the corridors. I loved the Dorsett Regency. It was great value for money, spotless clean, and superb Customer Service

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel as long as other guests are not smoking!”
Reviews.Author: Solomamatraveller
Reviews.Content: My 2.5 year old daughter and I stayed here for 6 nights recently. The room was beautiful and very comfortable, although for the first few nights a smoker was saying nearby which made our room smell like an ashtray. Fortunately they must have left and the stay was much more pleasant. We were in 1807 and had a harbour view which was a nice surprise. Breakfast was yum, particularly the pancakes with strawberry and chocolate sauce. The shuttle bus was very efficient, and the driver lovely and very helpful. If you miss the bus just take a tram, not very fast, but a great way to see the sights

Reviews.Title: “Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Audreyjfk
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in Hong Kong over Handover weekend but we still managed to get a room online in the Dorsett Regency for a good rate (in fact, I would say that it was cheap considering the hotel is on Hong Kong island and includes free wifi and free breakfast). Not only that, but we got a room on the 25th floor, which had a partial view of the harbour. Though a bit out of the way (nearest station Sheung Wan and Hong Kong station for the airport express/ Disneyland are accessible via the free shuttle bus service that comes round almost every hour), the hotel is in a part of Kennedy Town that has its own charms. Close to the harbour, you can watch the sunset over the water while having drinks at one of the many restaurants just down the street (half a minute's walk away). There's no shortage of convenience stores around too. The service is great as the staff were very accommodating and attentive to our needs. From the moment you check in, you're given an information pack with a map, interesting places to visit, hotel address card and the shuttle bus schedule. They also helped me post my postcards, provided us with extra pillows, and even sent my shopping packages straight to my room. Not only that, but they are always rushing to open the doors for us. All of the staff are very friendly too, from the concierge to the housekeepers, they are always warm and full of smiles. While the rooms are small (but to be expected of Hong Kong rooms in general) the furnishings are sparkly, quite fancy and very clean. There was a bay window in the room too, which was great for sitting on or if you have extra luggage, you can use it too. The room even came with little luxuries like an iPhone/iPod dock, Sony flat screen TV, automated blind/screen for the bathroom window and rain shower. The only issue I really had was that the shower takes a while to drain the water so the floor tends to flood a bit. Other than that, it was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “too many flaws made the stay upsetting”
Reviews.Author: solobolo
Reviews.Content: While the place is nicely appointed and clean, there were a couple things that made this hotel a less than attractive place to spend a night, let alone 4 as I did. Firstly, I had a hard time getting to sleep due to the noise in the hallways. The guests themselves were rude, but also it seems the doors are a bit slim to sufficiently keep out the noise. Also, while the breakfast was fantastic as far as variety and flavour, the restaurant is way too small. Being a single traveller, I like to eat alone, but due to the size of the dining area, that was clear it was not going to be an option. I did, however, find a time that was not as busy thinking this would enable me my privacy. No chance. Although there were at least nine tables unoccupied, the waiter decided I needed a "buddy" to sit with. Very rude in my opinion. Full house, I understand cramming guests, but a less than full house can respect individuality a bit more. The location is convenient, shuttle service superb, and other staff (not restaurant) excellent and accomodating. My suggestion: spend a bit more and get near a subway station and also a place with a bigger dining room.g

Reviews.Title: “High Value at a very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: KiwiGirl_in_Aussie
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights in this hotel. We were upgraded on arrival to a premier harbour view room. The room was large and spacious and I personally liked the modern styling with a boutique twist. The bathroom was gorgeous and massive. There is a rain shower as well as a full size bath with built in tv. The location of the hotel is a little out of the way mainly due to the fact that there is no mtr line in this region as yet. However taxis are cheap and there are also buses close by. We took the ding ding tram to Happy Valley races which was an experience not to be missed. However I wouldn't suggest this form of transport on a daily basis as its not fast! The breakfast was OK but I can't rave about it. It was also very crowded in the breakfast room so space is going to be an issue for this hotel as its popularity grows. Staff were efficient and pleasant which is all you really need on a leisure trip. Would I stay here again? Yes I would if I got the same price but the hotel doesn't have the x factor of some other options in HK. BTW the hotel shuttle bus is excellent and very clean. If it ran more frequently and for a longer duration (currently stops at 8pm) then this would overcome the drawbacks of the location. The areas around the hotel seemed very safe and pleasant but there is just not a lot to do. Also we couldn't find anywhere near the hotel to change currency which is a bit of a nusiance. All in all a good hotel with some minor drawbacks but great styling.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jantox r
Reviews.Content: Went there with my wife for our honeymoon last April 2012 and we were surprised how clean the room was. The view was good albeit only a portion of the seaview can be seen. The buffet breakfast lacks some other more western foods. The distance of the hotel from downtown HK was not a problem as it is very accessible with a taxi or bus or if you want to be more exotic via tram. Overall would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: travellalotmum
Reviews.Content: We only had a 1 night stopover in Hong Kong and we chose this hotel because it is new and had good reviews. My only regret was that we did not have several days to enjoy this lovely hotel. Our room was superb. The view from our room on the 32nd floor was magnificent, especially at night. The bed was extremely comfortable. We had a spa bath in our room which I totally enjoyed after a long flight. Breakfast was very nice with lots of choice on the buffet as well as ordering the custom made omelette which I always have when travelling in China. The shuttle bus ran on time and the driver was most helpful. Check in and check out was a breeze. The price was very reasonable for Hong Kong and included breakfast. I have stayed in dozens of Hotels in Hong Kong over the years and this one is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel--but billing problem”
Reviews.Author: wintersc
Reviews.Content: This hotel (as other reviewers have pointed out) provides excellent value for money. Room is small but very pleasant, with all sorts of "designy" features. Good breakfast and wifi are included in the price. The neighborhood--Kennedy Town--is pure super-high-density Hong Kong, like no other place in the world. Hotel staff are quite pleasant. Only catch: I'd made the reservation on booking.com, which asked for prepayment. The hotel insisted that I pay again, promising to refund the original payment. I was leaving a bit late for the airport and did not put up as stern a fight as I probably should have. I checked out 2 weeks ago and have yet to get the refund. When you have to pay twice for the same room, the hotel does not seem like much of a bargain. I've been booking hotels online since 1998 and have occasionally had to prepay before. This is the very first time that a hotel has not accepted my prepayment as, well, payment. I'm not happy. I'll admit that I'm not sure whether to blame booking.com or the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in a totally unique location”
Reviews.Author: Linear
Reviews.Content: Initially we were worried about staying so far out of Central but the reliability of the shuttle service (with a really great and helpful driver) and the unique location soon convinced us that we had made the right choice. The hotel is situated right in the middle of an area where average Hong Kong citizens live. You feel extremely safe and even welcomed. The breakfast service is efficient and varied enough so that over a six day stay we didn't get bored. However, we had a trouble getting used to the window from the bathroom that faced to external hotel window. Whilst the blind provided when needed, the window was an unnecessary intrusion. Staff were always helpful and attentive. Explore the nearby restaurants where the locals eat as they offer great value for money and you can be assured that the food is good - no not good ... great !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring central areas”
Reviews.Author: highimpactuk
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at this hotel while on a family vacation to HK and China. As there were 5 of us, and having read that the hotel was in a slightly obscure location, we decided to take a book a taxi van straight from the airport. If arriving late (as we did) and more than 4 people, it is in my opinion, the better option - as it almost cost neutral when you factor in the airport express costs. Arriving this way meant we did not have to worry about searching for bus stops or lugging baggage on public transport. The hotel knew we were arriving late and we had requested 2 interconnecting rooms. It transpired that they don't have these - although no one bothered to inform us. Nonetheless, we got 2 rooms next to each other on a high floor - which was fine. The rooms themselves were slightly smaller than expected - having stayed in other hotels in the Kowloon area previously. For a few days though, we had no issues. The hotel is a boutique hotel with a somewhat retro-contemporary style – similar to some European boutique hotels. The rooms themselves are quite compact (square footage is very expensive in HK so people should not be surprised at this). The bathroom has a decent shower with a “waterfall” feature. As is the case when you go east, there is plentiful supply of bath accessories – such as toothbrush, slippers, etc. We could have done with extra pillows but did not bother requesting any. Our package included breakfast and while children may struggle for options, they have continental and some English choices – so you will get croissants, toasts, ham, juices as well as some local Chinese options – such as noodles. They also have a chef preparing omelettes a la carte and fresh fruits (melon, pineapples, peaches, etc) which is a nice touch. The swimming pool is a mere dipping one located next to the restaurant on the 3rd floor and was not available during our stay. Even if it was open, I doubt we would have wanted to use it – so don’t plan with this in mind. Due the location of the Hotel in Kennedy Town, travel to the sights and other areas could be quite expensive. However, there are ways to keep costs down. Here is my suggestion for travel from the hotel: To Central Areas – Use the Hotel shuttle bus. This is free but needs to be booked in advance. You will be given a schedule of departure times when you check-in. Should this schedule not work for you, take a taxi to Central for around $30HK and the use the MTR/Buses from there. To Kowloon – Taxis cost over $100HK as you will need to pay the toll crossing charge. Get to Central (as above) and then take the Star Ferry to Kowloon. If you take the shuttle, this trip will end up costing you around $10HK for 4 /persons. There is a ferry every few minutes and you could also return this way. Overall, the hotel was good value for money and if you get a breakfast package, when added to the free shuttle and free WIFI, it is well worth considering in spite of some shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayDeeBee1950
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. We were upgraded to a premium room which helped as we had lots of luggage & a standard room would have been very crowded. However the facilities were very good with good bathroom & a power plug in the bathroom for an Australian razor. Free wifi at good speed. Breakfast was included but we missed it because of travel plans but other guests said it was good. Two lifts seemed not enough as we were on floor 32 but waiting only at busy times. Staff were very helpful & understood English.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Compact”
Reviews.Author: Geoff7010
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Grand Harbour View room which did have views of the Harbour but mostly buildings adjacent the hotel. Room is very compact with very little space. Shuttle bus is good, fast and clean. Breakfast was plentiful although very busy on weekends, staff were very helpful, and Wifi adequate, however no gym and the pool was closed. Plenty of eating places in easy walking distance of the hotel, and good bus and tram service. Geoff

Reviews.Title: “Average Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petian1
Reviews.Content: Booked Dorsett Regency in Kennedy Town Hong Kong. Hotel advertised as 5 Star, but only 3 star at best. Boutique hotel in residential area of Hong Kong, out of the way. Rooms small, but clean and modern. Staff friendly. However, we booked Premium Harbour View Room, but on arrival were placed in a room on the opposite side with just a glimpse of the harbour. Insisted we had paid for harbour view room, and after some time, they agreed to move us to the harbour side. Great view once we were moved. Disappointed with the facilities available. Breakfast room very small and crowded. No lounge to sit at the end of the day to relax with a drink. We had to go elsewhere each time. Restaurant not conducive to nice meal in the evening. Area of the hotel had no facilities for a drink or decent restaurants, always had to take taxi or tram to have dinner or a drink to relax. Staff excellent and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recharged!”
Reviews.Author: aychuen
Reviews.Content: You may have considered this for the cheaper price they offer with the bigger rooms and facilities. I must agreed it is worthed it. The hotel provides shuttle services at Hong Kong Station, so you can take airport train and they will arrive at every hour 25mins sharp. make sure you inform them your arrive so probably they will look out for you or wait a little longer. With the shuttle services, its conveniently 15mins from Hotel to Hong Kong Stations. MTR are very convenient and you can reach Mong kok in another 20mins time. Alternatively, you can take the Ding Ding tram and have a slow drive into the city of Hong Kong, into Central, Admiralty and Causeway Bay (for only HKD2.50 regardless of distance, just make sure you take the right tram.) Have your octopus card ready! there is a restaurant and several convenient stores around the hotel, you can find food and necessities any time. the receptionist will provide you the wifi password upon your arrival. Kennedy town is actually near the sea, although you may not feel being near the seaside. At night, there are some pubs just near the tram terminal for dose of booze. Breakfast is just average at the hotel. you may want to be more adventurous to seek local good dim sum near Central. the room is very much more spacious (if you compare to other hotels in areas of mong kok and jordan) and toilet is fully functional. you will love to stay here if you hate the small cramp space other hotels offered. OH, last but not least, do use the airport check in service at the Hong Kong Station. you can leave your luggage with them and board the train to the airport. 30mins. i saw the construction of the MTR in the area, hopefully the price this good so we will return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: JunChyang
Reviews.Content: I stay this hotel only 1night before I heading to Macau,but I do wish to stay for more day! When we arrive HK station from airport,we take hotel free shuttle bus to hotel for check in! Free shuttle bus service is must for this hotel,because quite far to Central. When we arrive the hotel,we will quite impress,the hotel lobby look nice and modern,the staff are very friendly,not any difficulty for check in and we get the room very fast as we all need a room to rest. The room are clean and look new! Bathroom are so big than we think,got two wash basin,so no need to flight with ur roommate! You can try jacuzzi on bathtub while watching tv! The wifi are fast and stable! Breakfast buffet still ok and the restaurant are not big,so sometime need to queue! Overall I have nothing to complain this hotel,the price we paid are really worth it! Try to stay here if you prefer quiet place! And one more thing you must try is tram,take the tram to Central,ask hotel staff where can take tram,you surely won't regret it,but make sure you have enough time,because tram are moving slowly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..check out everything you need to know about it!”
Reviews.Author: sara m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dorsett Regency in May and had a great time. At first, we were a little skeptical considering it is located a little farther away from the hustle bustle of the city. We were upgraded to an executive suite which was very generous of the hotel manager. They really went out of their way to cater to our every need and kept a close watch on our stay at the hotel ensuring that we were well taken care of. This was one of the best boutique hotels we've stayed at throughout our trip to Sout-East Asia. Highly recommended. Should not be judged based on location but rather the quality of service they provide. Very upscale rooms. Here's a list of the pros and cons: Pros: Great service Breakfast is absolutely satisfying Hospitable staff Great views of Victoria harbour Easy accessibility from the train station Shuttle takes you to the IFC mall which is useful as that will be your gate way into downtown, the subway station is located there. Only a shuttle bus ride away from IFC mall - which is a great way to spend an evening, shopping and checking out the restaurants. There's also a roof top patio where you can bring your own food to and view the stunning Hong Kong skyline at night. Away from the loud noisy and somewhat smelly downtown tourist area Cons YET still highly recommended: The shuttle bus only comes hourly The area that the hotel is located in is a bit gheto-like, not an area that really fits the hotels look and appeal How to get from the airport to the hotel: (Note the shuttle only operates till 8p.m so you should take a taxi to the hotel, its very inexpensive. Let them know you need to go to Kennedy Town, to the New hotel, Doorsett Regency). The airport is connected to a major Hong Kong (central) train station. Take some money out at the ATM machine (by the tourist information desk) You can take the airport train directly to either the Kowloon island or the Hong Kong island To get to Doorsett get off at Hong Kong Station (last station) Buy your tickets at the ticket desk which you can't miss when you're walking away of the airport section of the station. You have a choice of either buying just a round trip ticket for the airport train or buying a 4 day subway pass plus a round trip airport train ticket (it really depends on how much you'll be using the subway, we made really good use out of it because we didn't have to worry about getting around as much) The train is very safe and inexpensive compared to taking a taxi into the city. It's also a great way to see the city. Room for Improvement: 1. Would be useful if the shuttle came every 30 min and operated until 1a.m daily

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Lanikai_808
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights in April 12'.. It was a last minute booking being at the Chek Lap Kok Airport at 2 am and the hotel had only one room left, a handicap accessible room with a single bed for about $100 USD a night.. I inquired with hotels that had booths at the airport such as Regal Airport Hotel also called a few other hotels and they all wanted over $250 USD a night so I went ahead and booked the room with Dorsett Regency and took a taxi to the hotel.. If you arrive at Chek Lap Kok Airport at a more reasonable time you can take the Airport Express Link to Hong Kong Station.. Dorsett Regency Hotel is a very modern and clean hotel.. My room was not large as it was a single room but was modern, clean, had a power adapter and the bed was comfortable. It sits in a residential area on Hong Kong Island and has a few convenience stores and food places nearby.. Right across the street from the hotel is a hole in the wall Chinese restaurant recommended by the the hotel night staff.. The hotel offers a decent breakfast buffet each morning, free wi-fi throughout the hotel and has a swimming pool but it was drained during my stay.. The hotel offers a free shuttle service from the hotel to Hong Kong Station about a 5-10 minute drive from 7 am to 8 pm.. The hotel sits in a residential area away from the tourist area, but this was not a problem or inconvenient to me.. Like other guest have said you can also take a tram or bus to get you into the tourist area, however I did not use either.. In conclusion if you are on a budget and do not mind being just a bit outside of the tourist area then you will like Dorsett Regency Hotel..

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: freakytsz
Reviews.Content: I might be very biased in this case because i grew up in K Town so the biggest "downside" for many is actually an upside for me. K Town is actually very well connected if you figure out where to take the tram and buses towards Central / Causeway Bay: from the hotel entrance, turn left and just keep walking straight (towards the sea) and the 2nd crossroad you will see tram rail - that's where you take the tram and buses to the center (all trams, and buses number 1, 10, 5 and its derivatives). as for taxi, expect to pay about 30 HKD (3 Eurs) from central back to the hotel. ok, small rooms but very big bed and very functional bathroom and nice shower. renovation material is not excellent but all is still in very good shape given it is like 7 months old. for this price, very happy with these.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to Hong Kong for our honeymoon and chose Dorsett Regency HK as our hotel after reading many reviews on travel websites. I have to say I wasn't disappointed. The hotel's staff were professional,polite and friendly. The room was a bit smaller than we had expected but it had everything one would need and generally enough space. You could see the harbour if you get the sea view rooms which is quite pleasant, the breakfast at the hotel was quite nice and me and my wife ate quite a lot of the food there for the first week or so. :) The only downside to the hotel is maybe the transport everyday via bus to Sheung Wang or central MTR station but you get used to it after a few days. Overall a good experience and next time when we go back to Hong Kong for holiday Dorsett Regency HK is definitely top on our list.

Reviews.Title: “The Service Is Top-Notch”
Reviews.Author: acidreign3000
Reviews.Content: As others said, this hotel is not on the MTR line yet... but that's really the only flaw. Even with that in mind, the hotel shuttle to Central is very convenient and the Trams and Busses are just a short walk away. Kennedy Town is bustling with activity and seems like it's becoming a trendy place in its own right. This is a very nice hotel, and the service is top-notch. From the e-mail communications prior to the trip to every communication with hotel staff while onsite, their goal was to provide a great experience. Just one example: We left the "Do Not Disturb" light on because I was ill one day and stayed in the room. The maid called later in the day to confirm everything was OK... after I told her I felt ill and hung up, the front desk called to ask how I was feeling and if I needed anything: medicine, a doctor, etc. Then the next day as we passed through the lobby, everyone asked how I was feeling! Everyone else was just as great, I could go on and on... what a great hotel experience. Thank you Dorsett Regency, Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at an average location.”
Reviews.Author: arpan-chat
Reviews.Content: The only issue is the location i guess. Its about 20 minutes taxi ride from the central or the nearest MTR. Although i think there is a station coming up pretty soon, next to the hotel. The rooms are quite comfortable with huge bathrooms. Wifi is free @ an average speed. Breakfast is 5/10. But the staff is very very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable price ,new ,clean ,nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ali h
Reviews.Content: it was lovely hotels ,the rooms size was small but for hong kong room the size was ok ,very clean ,the breakfast not big or alot of varity but u will find what u can eat and what u like .the location a little bit far away from metro station but it is ok for free shuttle bus which goes every an hour ,the area around the hotel it is fine ,there are kfc and mc donalds about 20 meters ,and taxi stand stop about 25 meters ,ask receptionist to write the name of the hotel and its adress in their language cos most of taxi drivers don't knew english . the swimming pool is small and closed for maintance untill september 2012,there is no fitness center

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel on Hong Kong island”
Reviews.Author: Autumn_Fish09
Reviews.Content: I did some research on TA before settling on Dorsett Regency as I'm travelling with my parents (above age of 60 and a little fussy) and my sister. I find this to be a real value for money hotel on HK island as the rates for most hotel are usually higher than Kowloon. Here are what I think of this place: Pros: 1. LOCATION: You pay for what you get. The location is not in the central of everything as Kennedy town is 6min by taxi ride away to IFC mall (HKD52-60), 20-min tram ride to Central station(HKD2.50) or there's free shuttle bus from the hotel every hour. Very convenient to get around and do take the tram ride. It's really interesting... 2. ROOMS: The rooms are clean and new.The feeling is modern design with an interesting door. There's an iphone charger in the room which is very convenient. The toilet has rain forest shower head and it is pretty awesome to use. I was staying in room 2207 and 2209 and we had a good view of the harbour except some crane is in the way on certain days and obstruct the view a litle. 3. FOOD: Breakfast was good in general, with a good mix of western and asian dishes. I like the pancakes and I find their salad selection good. Please turn up EARLY as we were there at 7.30am and there were still seats until it reaches 8am, the breakfast queue was all the way to the elevator. 4. SERVICE: The staff at the reception area seems generally fast and well-trained. We had asked for various information from where to board on the tram to what time does Ngong Ping open to where can we get dim sum in the neighbourhood. All our questions were answered attended to promptly and efficient and always with a smile. The staff are excellent with their knowledge. CONS: 1. BEDSHEETS: Okay I'm a little fussy about the sheets and here's what I noticed. There seems to be really fine black lint all over the white bedsheet on the first day I arrive and I supposed this is due to the bedsheet being washed along with other materials. I had to use my link remover to scrub off the black lint to feel okay as I have a sensitive nose. This is really minor. 2. SHUTTLE BUS: Do inform the young driver where you are going when you get on the bus as they make stops sometimes at Sheung Wan first and sometimes at the IFC mall first. So if you do want to make it to the correct stop, it's better to make sure you know when is the next stop. 3. FACILITIES: There's a pool next to the breakfast area and I was thinking who in the right frame of mind would do laps when the neighbours in the opposite block can see you. TIPS: 1. ROOM: There is a very long marble seating area next to the window so if you are having an extra guest in the room, you can probably ask for extra bedsheet and the third "bed" can be set up. 2. There's a ttv-insider channel which was very helpful as the days go by and I ran out of tourist places to bring my parents to tour, the suggestions on the channel were good help. The hotel has placed 2 guides/maps on the room desk and those were updated and useful. There's also small cards placed near the reception and breakfast area for tourists to pick up. These cards tell you how to get to some spots.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a gem in an under-rated location”
Reviews.Author: JnAlP
Reviews.Content: This is a great little gem of a hotel, located a short taxi (HK$40), tram (HK$2.30), or mini-bus (free) ride from Central. Probably closer to the action than North Point and well serviced by transport, this is actually a very convenient location. The rooms are maybe small by some standards (but normal -even large for HK), clean and functional. I found the bed to be extremely comfortable. Added bonuses include: free Wi-Fi, free regular mini bus service to Central, free breakfast (with our room deal) - and the breakfast is not bad. Our room rate was excellent value for money. The only down side is the decor which is quite camp (the designer definately bats for the other side), and the tiling in the shower cubicle is quite poor workmanship. Staff are efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: pronews
Reviews.Content: Researched and compared a number of Hong Kong hotels for five-day stay in May 2012, and settled on this Kennedy Town property because of good reviews. The good: Yes, it is a value for money hotel. Staff were mostly helpful, breakfast was fine and the outer location wasn't much of a drawback with good bus and tram links. Apart from one issue, we had a pleasant stay. The bad: we were flat-out lied to when we checked in. We had booked a premier harbour view room with king bed four months before trip. On arrival at 10pm such a room was not available. Front desk apologised profusely and said we'd have to make do with two singles the first night before a double bed was available, but by way of compensation they would upgrade our room type. Fine: we were tired and just wanted to sleep. They next day they did push the beds together and made up with appropriate bedding. Two days later I wondered what kind of "upgrade" we had got and checked the hotel's own website. Imagine my displeasure when it appeared we had actually got a downgrade to a grand harbour view room, according to the respective photos on the web site (check it yourself if you are thinking of booking here: two windows in the premier room versus on in the grand). I went down and challenged the duty manager on this. Much muttering and shaking of head. He could not explain the discrepancy in the photos but kept insisting our one-window room was a premier room. I accepted his word but pointed out the obvious case of misleading advertising. As for the declared upgrade, the only way "up" would have been to a suite and our room, perfectly adequate as it was for a five-day stay, was most definitely a single room. The manager offered to shift us to a suite for the final two nights of our stay but the inconvenience of repacking and moving wasn't worth it and the offer was declined. In summary: the front desk of this hotel appears to have a regrettable tendency to assume the phrase "upgrade" will fool gullible and/or weary travellers into accepting something less than they have paid for. I'm still not sure whether we were victims of outright fraud or merely misleading advertising but the room we booked did not reflect the photos of that of the same category as displayed on the hotel's website. The moral of this tale: buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Kennedy Town”
Reviews.Author: drskin
Reviews.Content: This slightly out of the way hotel won't stay hidden for long. It is hip in its interior design and has a very well trained and friendly staff. It is located in Kennedy Town which is west of the Central district of Hong Kong Island. We stayed there for 6 days while visiting family in the Central district. We were having a hard time obtaining accommodations for less than 200 USD per night and decided on this hotel from reading other Tripadvisor recommendations. It is easy to get around HK because of the abundant taxis and public transportation. There is a taxi stand one block away from the hotel, an HSBC ATM practically next door and several very nice and well priced restaurants within a few blocks including a coffee shop across the street and a couple of nice bakeries less than a block away. That is if you decide not to get the buffet breakfast (ours was included in the price of the room). The breakfast was very complete with both Chinese and Western offferings including an egg/omelette station. The night manager Tom, was extremely nice and helped us when we encountered a problem with our initial room. We had booked a harbor view room but when we got there, there was a construction crane from a building next door that was blocking our view. He moved us to a higher floor to take care of the problem. He spoke perfect English and was friendly and very helpful with all of our needs. We could not have asked for a better hotel and nicer staff. This is a 4.5 star hotel at a 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maestr0
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something nice and friendly when deciding where to stay in Hong Kong. This Hotel was exactly this. Front desk where very helpful and all the staff where very accommodating and yes ... friendly! This Hotel is located a bit out of town in Kennedy Town and taxi drivers didn't seem to recognise the name when asked to take me there. The hotel did supply a business card with the address but the writing on the card was very small and some drivers could not see it clearly. The room was a grand harbour view room and was a little more expensive. The view was not all that grand and I had to look out the window at an angle to appreciate the harbour. Being Hong Kong I would probably go for the standard room next time and save a little. And in Hong Kong the last thing you want to do is stay in your room! The Hotel supplies a shuttle to the harbour that runs once an hour. From here you can get around quite easily and the harbour ferries to Kowloon are very cheap. Breakfast was a real treat with lots to temp you and an egg station for freshly cooked eggs or omelettes. Service was excellent with the staff being very helpful. The room also was very pleasant looking over a small pool. The room I was staying in was quite small but well appointed. Also, surprisingly the bed was small and my feet hung over the end of the bed. I am not overly tall so the bed seemed a little short? However I have to say I slept quite well and was comfortable. Go figure? Overall I had a good stay at the Dorsett and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a hotel in Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: imcv
Reviews.Content: With a country like Hong Kong that had a very efficient transportation system, we figured that booking a hotel in a location not near the train system will not be much of a problem. And, indeed, it wasn't. Dorsett Regency's website has comprehensive info on how to find their hotel, but they didn't have different options for transportation. Most taxi drivers know where Davis Street is. If you're going to the hotel by bus, you can also just look for a bus that goes into Kennedy Town and just make sure to stop at the Luen Bong Apartments bus stop. The hotel is just a few minutes walk from there. They also have an hourly 24 hour shuttle van service stopping at the Shun Tak Centre and the ifc Mall Airport Express Terminal, which we got to take full advantage of during our trip. We were placed on the 32nd floor, the top floor. We're not particular about views but I just loved seeing the Kowloon island and Hong Kong island skylines from our room. Each floor was also uniquely designed and I loved the modern and classy decor. Two things I noticed with the room were that there wasn't a clothing iron at hand and the jacuzzi feature in our tub was difficult to figure out, if it even worked at all. The pool also was out of service when we were there. We tried the buffet breakfast once. Nice choices, but not so extensive. The dining space was cramped and we were sharing a table with another American guy (fiance: "our new dining friend"), which we felt iffy about. Haha! I guess my tip here is to avoid the rush hour for dining. We only tried the hotel food once because there are lots of choices for food outside the hotel. We loved getting pastries from this little bakery just a few minutes walk along Belcher Street. They had these amazing coconut buns and pork buns. There were also restaurant chains nearby and a food centre if you're adventurous. :)

Reviews.Title: “Supper”
Reviews.Author: oaltug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on the island in November, HongKong. New and very nice hotel. There are free shuttle service to the city center. Also currently under construction will offer excellent connections to the metro station is finished. Ding Ding is also the island's trams for transportation within the transportation very easy and can provide an inexpensive way. Very easy to reach from the airport to the city. The hotel rooms are large and spacious. The staff is very welcoming. I did not get breakfast, but a very nice breakfast buffet. A very nice restaurant and shopping facilities are available nearby. Ho Coi Restaurant is ideal for very cheap and a real taste of the local Dim Sum can be obtained from reception at a location very close to the hotel. I would definitely recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with two problems”
Reviews.Author: Retired_Gentleman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for almost two weeks in the Dorsett Regency, a modern hotel located in Kennedy Town at the west of Hong Kong Island. Rooms. My room was small, as is normal in Hong Kong, but well maintaned and perfectly adequate and the shower was one of the best I have experienced. However, there were two problems. The toilet bowl is a terrible design and no amount of flushing would clean the back. With not even a toilet brush provided, I had the choice of leaving it for the cleaner or using toilet paper manually, which is what I did. The other problem is traffic noise. Even on the 19th floor with curtains drawn, I was aware of traffic noise outside from about 5.30am. Eating. The hotel provides an excellent buffet breakfast and there are several bars and many cheap restaurants close by. Transport. I notice one reviewer commenting on the distance from the airport and town - I took the airport shuttle to Central and a taxi to the hotel....quick and relatively inexpensive. The hotel is not right in the city centre - you have to pay a lot more for hotels if you want to stay there - but there are many modes of cheap transport near the hotel. These will be augmented when the MTR extension to Kennedy Town is complete in 2014.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit outside”
Reviews.Author: Koblberger
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night at the Dorsett Regency from 12th to 13th of February. We arrived very late at 9pm with Emirates from Munich over Dubai. After picking up the luggage we tried to find the place where the pick up for the free hotel transport. Unfortunately the van from Dorsett is just runnig till 8pm. We send the hotel a mail before we arrived in HK but they didn´t send us this information or even told us how to get to the hotel so late in the evening. So we took the airport express to Central. We bought the 3day ticket for 300HKD with which you can travel with MTR as much and as long as you want. From Central you have to take the blue line to Sheung Wan. There leave the station at Connaught Road. You find there the double deck tramcars. Normally a very funny way to travel but with big luggage it is too small. Leave at Davis Street and from there it is just a short walk to the hotel. The Dorsett itself was a surprise. Especially if you compare it with the others hotels in HK. One night later we stayed at the Panorama by Rhombus in Kwoloon which was double the price of the Dorsett. The room was very nice and modern. There is a big flatscreen and a Ipod docking station. The bathroom was great with a big window into the living room. Breakfast was good but if you don´t want a normal coffee and take a hot chocolate or cappucino you have to pay extra for it. We left the next morning to the Panorama which is in the middle of Kowloon and much better if you want to explore HK. This time the free shuttle was available. After all the Dorsett would be a great hotel if there would be a underground near by or anything else which brings you into the town.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: TxTravelPro
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried to stay off the beaten path in Kennedy Town, but as this was the assigned hotel, I resigned myself to it and eventually embraced it after reading reviews. I must say that not only did I enjoy the residential feel of the neighborhood, but I did not find the location a problem at all! I loved the hotel. Clean and very well appointed... Not unlike any upscale hotel. This is an upscale hotel disguised as a mid-tier hotel. Big TV with some US channels, nice decor, sweeping spectacular views of Hong Kong Harbour from my 2 giant windows complete with space for seating. A desk with a nice plug box, refrigerator, robes and jacuzzi tub. Just a great room. Quiet, too. The shuttle runs from 8am-8pm I think and I used it 4 or 5 times over the course of a week. The desk staff was amongst the best I have seen. Friendly and young. Breakfast was ok. I opted to sleep in most days and grab something at one of the great bakeries that surround the hotel. Bottom line, I plan to stay in KT on future trips if this sweet little property maintains its quality. Excellent value!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lhouse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood. We walked around the area and we felt very safe. There is a bank next to the hotel, although there are Circle K stores nearby where you can also get cash. The free shuttle, which runs every hour to Hong Kong station, will pick up hotel guests 25 minutes after every hour from the same place where they drop you off directly back to the hotel. Be on time as driver does not wait around. If you miss the hotel shuttle, you can take the taxi for about 40 HKD back to the hotel or take the slow tram. The room was small by American standards, but big enough for two people. We had the full harbor view, but the room with the partial harbor view also provides a nice view of the town and the harbor. We asked for a room on the higher floor, and the management was very kind to accommodate our requests and did their best as well to put all my family members on the same floor. Our room was clean. We didn’t have problems with the shower drain or the sink drain. The rain shower had very good water pressure. I liked the glass partition between the bedroom and the bathroom because I could watch the television while brushing my teeth, and you could lower down the blinds using the switch next to the sink if you want privacy. There are also several light switches and it took us a while to figure which lights are operated by each switch. The beds were comfortable, too. As for breakfast, we were stuffed every morning. The food was delicious and served buffet-style – bread, sausages, beef steaks, chicken wings, congee, hash browns, noodles, dim sum, a selection of vegetables for you to make your own salad, eggs cooked for you the way you want them, boiled eggs, fresh fruits, coffee, tea, and juice. The hotel staff helped us all the time with all our needs (directions, taxi, blankets, extra hangers, extra soap, etc.). They all spoke very good English, too. Everyone was polite and friendly. The service was A+. They even gave us a plate of fruits on our last night as a way of an apology for the hotel shuttle accident, which didn’t injure anyone on board. We witnessed the verbal fight between the hotel shuttle driver and the taxi driver as they took off from Hong Kong station, which then led to a side-by-side collision in the tunnel, causing us all passengers to anxiously wait for the police and the hotel to come and rescue us. Luckily, no one was hurt, not even the taxi driver and his passenger. It’s too bad we don’t speak the language or we would have fully understood what happened that night. The other passengers in our shuttle only spoke Cantonese, so I’m sure they understood what happened. The following morning, the hotel had a new shuttle driver. We spoke with the management and they told us they would update us by email. I highly recommend the hotel to those who don’t mind being away from the central location.

Reviews.Title: “a good one to stay”
Reviews.Author: MoOnLeAn
Reviews.Content: Had stay in serval 4/5/3 stars hotels in Hong Kong before, this one is by far the best value of all. Yes, it is out of the main tourist parts, but Hong Kong is a tiny city and a taxi ride is cheap. Yet, if you are not in a hurry to explore the city in 1/2 days, take a tram( a min walk down toward the harbour along davis street, tram and taxi are in easy reach), which not only given u a cheap city sight tour (hk$2.30) but it also takes you to the MTR stations, the nearest one is sheung wan (the MTR will take u to almost every part of Hong Kong). Look out of the MTR logo along the road. Let get back to the Hotel. The room I booked is a premier room which wifi and breakfast are included. I have attached a few pictures with the review. The room is spacious (by Hong Kong stardards). I am surprise by the restrooom, which is the biggest one I ever stay with. There is a jaccuzi and a telly to watch. Room service are great. The receptionist are well trained. Breakfast....well, is okay, very much the same as other hong kong hotel. The swimming pool were closed during my stay, but I wonder anyone would swim in the tiny pool there... well, is like a pond to me. The smallest I ever seen. If u enjoy a pool side rest in a hotel, do not book in this hotel. It will disappoint u badly. While waiting for my room, I over heard the receptionist talking over the phone to asist someone to find the hotel. So my tip to u is, tell the taxi driver davis street is at the end of belcher's street, the street after smithfield street. To help those wanna book this hotel, copy this and print this out : 爹核士街, 卑路乍街尾, 士美菲路下一條街 - 帝盛洒店-聯威新樓對面 The MTR will reach this part of Hong Kong within a few years, so I could see the price of this hotel will rocket up. At the moment, is really good for value. All and all, I will recommend this hotel for its high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent value, interesting location”
Reviews.Author: Cfan41
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice, new hotel but it is in Kennedy Town. That means that it is a 10min cab ride to central, 15min on the bus (10min if 5x bus) and 25min by tram. The hotel provide a hourly mini-bus service that takes you to the Airport Express Station and also Central - which is very good. The rooms are beautiful as is the rest of the hotel. The design is exceptional and well planned out. The staff are very good and helpful as they could be. The breakfasts are excellent - good range of food (western and asian) as well as an omelette station. Around the hotel is everything you would need including coffee shops, loads of restaurants, supermarket. Except that it is a bit out of Central it is in an up and coming and great place to live in Hong Kong. I noticed there is a MTR station being built near the hotel and when that is done it will be just brilliant. In terms of value and what you get for what you pay this is probably my new favourite in Hong Kong and I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: louiscoco
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for 9 days March 2012 and can not fault it. The location is great in a non touristic part of Hong Kong but easy to access the Ferry/MTR and also local buses and trams. The free shuttle bus was also very good. Our room had a great view of the harbour and was spacious, clean and bright. Daily breakfast which was included in the price was very varied and delicious including fruit,yoghurt, eggs cooked your way, bacon, beans, chops, asian noodles and the list goes on! Lots of local restaurants to choose from, look for the ones where the locals eat for good fresh cheap food. We would highly recommend this hotel, the staff were always very helpful, courteous and friendly and the whole experience enhanced our stay in wonderful Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freoshocker
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although a little out of the main tourist parts of Hong Kong is a great place to stay. The hotel is new and the lodgings were clean and functional. Breakfast and WIFI was included in the price of the room. The staff were very helpful, especially when we required a taxi one morning, one staff member took off around the corner and moments later he was back with a taxi. You can go out for a walk without there being thousands of people around. It is still mainly a local area with all of their shops and not the tourist traps. It is a great insight into local life and we never felt threatened as we walked around the area. There are some nice restaurants in the area. To get into the main part of the island we took the tram (HK$2.30) which took about half an hour to get to Central. From Central you are able to get too all places by bus and MTR. One handy thing the hotel did do, was to give you a piece of paper with the hotel directions (in Chinese) so if you do get a taxi back to the hotel. As this hotel is relatively new, you can show the driver the directions so he knows where to go (If the hotel could put this on their website it would be very handy so patrons could print out prior arriving at the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, brilliant staff and feels like an authentic area”
Reviews.Author: NTIcedCoffee
Reviews.Content: We loved it. A large sized room with all the facilities you should expect; staff that were enthusiastic about helping in any way possible; and, it still feels brand new and clean. But what we liked best was that the area felt like Hong Kong, not just another westernised location. There were local restaurants to choose from in the vicinity of the hotel and walking around you knew you were in Hong Kong / China / Asia from the sights / sounds / smells and organised chaos. However, when we wanted to go to other areas in HKG there was the outbound bus (very simple - on the hour, every hour - just tell the reception staff where you want to get off and it's sorted) to quickly get us to Central MTR station. We missed the last bus back a couple of evenings so caught the ding ding tram (direction: Kennedy Town) for a slower ride back and it terminates just around the corner from the hotel. When catching the hotel shuttle bus from the Airport Express station 'Hong Kong' (joined to 'Central' MTR station) just go up to the drop in town airport check in desks area which is also the taxi / shuttle bus / private car drop off area and wait at the exit door directly in front of Starbucks. The hotel was probably a little out of our normal price range, but all hotel rooms in HKG seemed expensive and this was worth it for the occasional splurge. (and we did book a higher rate room) No regrets at all and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in west HK Island”
Reviews.Author: Hernan_y_Tina
Reviews.Content: Being our second time in Hong Kong, we decided to try a new neighbourhood and after some research chose this new hotel in Kennedy Town. What a finding! Dorsett Regency is located in West Hong Kong Island, and there is no MTR station nearby (at least until the line extension is finished in 2014) . This was not a problem for us, as there is a complimentary shuttle service to Sheung Wan MTR station and several bus lines which allow you to reach the Central area in roughly 15 minutes. The good: - Our room was immaculate, and well equipped with gadgets such as an ipod docking station. We got a free upgrade, and were assigned to a room on the 30th floor, with great views of the harbour. Bed was very comfortable. - The bathroom was excellent, and included a hydro massage jacuzzi and a separate shower-head with good water pressure. There is a glassed window between bathroom and the room, which can be covered by an automatic blind. - As mentioned above, the location of this hotel was not an issue for us. There are many buses which leave you at a bus stop which is less than 50 mts away from the hotel: for instance, buses #101 and #104 from Soho area, and #18 and #18P from HK Convention & Exhibition Centre. There is a nice Pacific Coffee Company located in front of the hotel. Free shuttle to Sheung Wan MTR (where ferry leaves to Macau) and Hong Kong Station (from where you take the Airport Express) runs all day through. Otherwise a taxi from the ferry terminal will cost around 45 hkd. - There was free wifi internet within the hotel's premises. As always, this is very appreciated. The not-so-good - Not really a complaint, but just a tip if you are planning to book in this hotel: when taking the shuttle bus towards the city, let the driver know if your destination is Sheung Wan MTR. Otherwise the shuttle bus will go first to Hong Kong station (even if it is farther away) and only after that will return to Sheung Wan to pick up any passengers. I cannot comment on the breakfast as it was not included in our room rate. However, I got the chance to have a look at the breakfast area and it gave me a very good impression. The pool is located on that same level, though it was empty during the cold season. All I can say is that the management has done a good job here. Dorsett Regency is a nice 4-star hotel, which is striving hard to outstand in this category. At 100 usd/night, it is a very good deal in expensive Hong Kong, so we will probably stay here again next time we are in this city!

Reviews.Title: “a brand new hotel which already feels filthy”
Reviews.Author: Vivid_gb
Reviews.Content: If you, like us, would swap convenience of a central location for a brand new hotel, DO NOT do it for Dorsett Regency. The hotel, which opened late last year, already begins to look tired. The cleanliness is simply appauling (see the photos attached): although the room was serviced every day, it looked like they never bothered to clean in the corners or behind the toilet, those spaces were filled with old dust and hairs. The clusters of dust could be seen behind the wardrobe doors, scratch marks on the walls showed the evidence of several suitcases, fabric furnishing on the side of the desk had an obvious stain, the washbasin in the bathroom didn't drain properly. Shame. Our double room was tiny. To make the space look bigger they put a glass partition between the room and the bathroom, which looked cool until we needed the loo. It took us a while to figure out that there was a built-in blind to screen the undesirable view. However, the chambermaid kept raising it every time she cleaned the room. Wierd. Breakfast would have been OK had we eaten won tons and noodles for breakfast. But unfortunately we wanted a simple continental breakfast of cereals, youghurt and fruit. Fruit was good, however, there was only two types of cereals: rice crispies and chocolate rice crispies. One morning they run out of plain rice crispies and never refilled the container during our breakfast. The cereal bowls in their size resembled ashtrays and although I am not a big eater I had to go for a second helping. There was no option other than full fat milk. Disappointing. The location of the hotel is real inconvenient with no fast public transport links anywhere near it. There is a free hotel shuttle bus but only one per hour and if you choose to rely on it it might be frustrating. What we liked about this hotel was free wifi and the view from the room. Would we chose to stay there again - absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jaywalking_jay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a colleague's recommendation, who had been there and liked it - it's in residential area so getting to and from there is a bit of a pain - they do have a shuttle service to Shun Tak Centre and Hong Kong Station - but the staff is always confused about what time the shuttle is going where, even though there is a set schedule, and where they will pick you up from - they made us run around in Hong Kong Station for 20 minutes before telling us that the last shuttle is gone (it was supposed to come at 8.30, and we were running around in Hong Kong station from 8.15 because the staff kept passing the phone to each other and everyone thought the pick up point was something different - we had to stand out in the rain for an hour to get a cab back to the hotel - it was freezing. Rooms are tiny and cleverly designed, views are of depressing buildings in and around with a tiny sliver of sea peeking out from between buildings - this, from the 21st floor. The staff were polite and all, but taking the shuttle was really painful pretty much every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great quirky hotel in a real Hong Kong neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: chriskayTO
Reviews.Content: This new property is clearly striving to be a 5-star hotel, and they are doing a good job - the service, cleanliness, and amenities are nearly there. It's located in Kennedy Town on the western tip of Hong Kong Island, and is a "real" Hong Kong neighbourhood that is full of locals. The rooms are small by western standards, but standard, if not generous by Hong Kong standards. The bed and linens were comfortable, and the room had all of the expected features: a very lovely bathroom, a generous closet with storage shelves, in-room safe, in-room fridge, kettle, with coffee and tea, and a nice desk with concealed charging ports, which is quite thoughtful. An odd design feature is the window between the bathroom vanity and the bedroom, however any privacy concerns are addressed with an automatic blind that's operated with a wall switch. The shower had plenty of hot water, but one complaint was there there was no shelf or rack in order to put toiletries, and there were hardly any hooks or towel racks elsewhere in the bathroom, except for some racks below the vanity, which caused the bath towels to drag on the floor. This is a minor complaint, however. The included breakfast was quite good, with plenty of western and Asian selections, and an omelette bar. I never quite had the chance to use it, however, since every day it was quite busy with one lone pan to make omelettes. I also encountered a number of rude folks during breakfast, but this is certainly not the property's fault. The hotel also provided a free shuttle to Hong Kong station where you can transfer to the Airport Express or MTR - very handy and appreciated by us on more than one occasion. This hotel is located adjacent to a new stop on the Island MTR line, so in a few years access will be much easier. Protip: If you're looking to get some laundry done, skip the overpriced valet services, and walk it over to one of the many laundry counters nearby (there are at least two on Hau Wo Street) - they charge by the pound, and it's very cheap and done within a couple of hours. We took a whole pile over and it was about $4 USD or $30 HKD. There's a great coffee shop across the street - a branch of Pacific Coffee Company, and on the corner there's a yummy (and cheap!) little snack stall.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gusto2009
Reviews.Content: On our trip to Thailand, we decided to have a stopover in Hong Kong for three nights. It was our first trip to Hong Kong, apart from internet and stories from friends - we didn't know what to expect. After looking around online - we found DR - a new hotel in Kennedy town area. The website looks very nice and the rate was very reasonable for the island. Few weeks before our trip we received a nice email from the hotel admin asking us about our arrival time, and also information on how to get to the hotel from the airport. We arrived Hong Kong quite early on morning flight from London. They let us leave our luggages there as our room was'nt ready. The check-in process was routine and the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. We were quite taken back by the size of the lobby or the lack of lobby area. We were taken to our room - quite small but we were sort of expecting it anyway as it's HK. They provide iPod docking station - very handy. The bathroom was very nicely decorated and everything was in perfect order. We were on the 22nd floor - but being in HK, most of the view were either other flats across or other tall office building. The breakfast was standard - mixture of Asian (congee, fried noodles) and a bit of european - salad, fruits and breads etc. the egg station was handy, and friendly. The young chap who runs the station has quite limited English - had to explain to him few times that I like my egg quite well done and not too runny. But he was very nice about it and always smiley We were initially a bit apprehensive with the distance from Kennedy town to the central but the tram system was very good and handy. The hotel provides free shuttle service to the central or HK station - but we never used them. We found that the tram is so handy and cheap! HKD2.30 for a journey. You could also take mini bus no 56 two blocks from the hotel to go directly to the main pier - for star ferry crossing to Kowloon. For HKD4 something. Else taxi is always an option and reasonable. From central - it costs us normally around HKD 20-35 Plenty of small mini markets around, quite close the harbour and relatively quite neighbourhood with nice pace to it. It's a small and new boutique hotel with reasonable facilities, but lacks of charm and personalities. Good location with excellent transport network. A reasonable base to explore HK for a long weekend trip. And if you get good deal - I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “A bit overpriced...”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeTravellerCY
Reviews.Content: The layout of the room was not the usual standard as the beds were just next to the room door with not so much of privacy (guess it could be due to space constraints). Nevertheless, bathroom was huge with a long bath tub and rain shower by the side. Variety of the daily breakfast was quite limited at its cafe. The hotel was accessible by its own shuttle (white mini bus) every other hour from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily (leaving from the side door of the hotel lobby). We usually took a taxi if we happen to miss the shuttle bus. As the hotel was not located on the main road where taxi will be easily available, the hotel staff was kind enough to go to other roads to get taxi for the guests. Major down sides of the hotel room were its noisy aircon units and not so comfortable beds. The hotel was neither near to any recommendable eateries nor places of interests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location + great value”
Reviews.Author: indolence
Reviews.Content: Dorsett has a free shuttle service which is very convenient. It leaves from the hotel, stopping at HongKong MTR (right outside Airport Express), loops to the nearby ferry terminal and then stopping again at the MTR to pick up "left-over" passengers. HK MTR itself is walking distance to Airport Express and Central MTR and Central bus depot. Please note that the shuttle bus leaves the hotel ON THE DOT at each hour starting from 8am-8pm. It will arrive at the MTR at approximately 00.15 on the first pick up and 00.25 on the 2nd pick up. Wait outside at the Airport Express check-in, right in front of Starbucks. If you miss the bus or if it's full, the hotel is still very accessible by tram and bus.
