Multiple busses goes to central and the tram services runs across the island, past many places of interest but is a lot slower than the buses. Do equip yourself with an Octopus card as most of their transport systems use it. Forget getting the tourist Octopus card that gives you unlimited rides at 55HKD. You're better getting a normal Octopus card and topping up the value as and when you need. It's very convenient doing it at the MTR stations. Right in front of the hotel there is a small eatery that serves cheap and good food but you may have a slight problem if you don't speak Cantonese or Chinese. They serve the best milk tea I've ever had. Breakfast variety is limited but is not a big complaint for me. Rooms are decently sized for its prices and very comfortable. The room also comes with iPod/iPhone docks. Ask for a room on the higher floors that has a sea view. The hotel's location may not be at a central location but I'd rather pay the same price for a better quality room further off (as opposed to booking a small dingy room for the same price at say Mongkok or Tsim Tsa Tsui). Kennedy Town has character without all the hustle and bustle while not lacking in eateries and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “love it!”
Reviews.Author: miriamRP
Reviews.Content: this is my first stay in a far-from-the-main-city hotel. i want to try it out for a change since i was more accustomed to staying in city-proper hotels. i made a pledge that i would try-out every 3 to-4-stars hotels in hongkong and that i wouldn't repeat my stay unless i love that hotel so much. guess what, i would be staying again with my sisters in this hotel next month!! the lobby was not very spacious and i was a little bit apprehensive that my room will also be quite small. But my fear was unfounded and i was upgraded to an ok-sized-bright room at the 39th floor, if i remember correctly.it was located very much facing the elevators and i was thinking about sounds of the elevators comings or goings( that was what i read in some reviews). luckily, that didn't materialize. the walls are all-white and it gives the atmosphere a cheery-side ( i had stayed in some very dimly-lit-heavily-curtained hotel rooms and it gave me a queer feeling).it lives up to a modern new hotel room by installing a see-through glass in the bathroom overlooking the study table of the room. one can turn down the shades if one wants some privacy while bathing. i love the shower -heads the most! it has 2. one is a removable shower-head and another is a central top showerhead. my regrets so far was that i didn't try out the jacuzzi because i didn't know how to operate it. anyway, i can try out their jacuzzi on my next stay here next month. there's also this "place" along near the window wherein one can sit down on it and look to the streets. this also serves as a "luggage-placer". the staff were courteous. the hotel has nearby trams, buses, airport bus a few walks away only. my only complaint is the "breakfast". the food on display was not much although the variety of food was enough as breakfast items.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Emma R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our way to New Zealand, and would definitely stay here again. We were upgraded upon arrival and were given a suite on the 32nd floor, which was just amazing. Jacuzzi bath overlooking the city was spectacular. The only problem we found was that taxis generally hadn't heard of the hotel and were not sure how to take us there. This got a little tiresome after a while, even though we carried a map and driving directions with us all the time. But we always seemed to be able to get back to the hotel ok in the end, so it wasn't a massive deal, just a bit irritating! Wouldn't think twice about booking again, we loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: AKLS
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly, efficient and enthusiastic staff. Location was great with heaps of eateries around and all forms of transport on the main road just a few steps away from the hotel. Would definitely stay there again for the good value, location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Energetically helpful staff and very good room value”
Reviews.Author: Cliff S
Reviews.Content: We found the Dorsett Regency Hong Kong via booking.com and locked in a great price months in advance. We took advantage of their free shuttle bus, which picked us up at the Airport Express terminal at the Hong Kong MTR station. We got a free upgrade to a king-sized room upon checkin -- not sure why, but we were thankful just the same! The room was obviously new, very clean, modern and stylishly decorated. We especially loved the shower, with its rain showerhead. What impressed us most about the Dorsett Regency was the staff’s eagerness to please. When I noticed an unpleasant plumbing smell in the bathroom, and wrote about it on TripAdvisor, within hours, the management had called us on the phone to apologize, investigate and offer us another free upgrade. The new room was much more spacious with all the nice touches the old room had to boot. I had also mentioned that the coffee seemed weak, and the next morning there was a marked improvement. A Pacific Coffee shop is just across the street on the way to the tram and bus stops in case you need your fancy morning coffee fix. While out exploring on our own, we quickly discovered that a tram ride to the nearest MTR station -- Sheung Wan -- from the stop around the corner from the hotel takes quite a bit of time. The trams are quaint, but not fast. Buses are more convenient, but are more likely to get delayed in traffic due to construction. When the Island Line of the MTR is extended further west into Kennedy Town, the location of this hotel will be much more convenient for guests exploring Hong Kong’s Central and Causeway Bay and Kowloon areas. We'd probably stay here again, even though it tacks on a few minutes of getting started every day owing to the location. It's not hard to walk to interesting markets in Des Voeux and Queen's Road, but to get out of Kennedy Town on public transport, a little planning is required. It seems most of the buses heading into and out of Kennedy Town stop nearby, but two or three may come and go while you’re deciphering the bus routes. After a few days, you’ll get to recognize the bus numbers as they pull up to the stops near you, and you’ll be able to recognize and climb aboard advantageous ones with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent”
Reviews.Author: keith219
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to the Dorsett Regency and was very pleased that they not only remembered me but were even more helpful, enthusiastic and went out of their way to ensure I had a pleasant stay. The staff were just amazing and I felt quite at home. It is a great hotel and I shall return again without hesitation. Although they were very busy I felt very looked after. The complimentary shuttle bus leaves bang on time every time, it only takes ten minutes to get to the Central area and being slightly away from the city centre in my opinion adds to its charm. The breakfast is first rate and all in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Jim G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 3rd - 17th Feb and had a fantastic stay. The hotel appeared to be very new and clean and tidy. Staff were always friendly and helpful. We were somewhat concerned about the location, but we should not have worried ourselves, as the hotel has a shuttle bus that runs pretty much on the hour. They can drop you at Hong Kong station/Central within about 10min. It only costs about US$5 for the same ride in a taxi if you would prefer it. There are a few great little restaurants a short walk down Davis St, just before the waterfront. For anyone who wants a break from the usual Chinese cuisine, we had some fantastic burgers at the Tapas bar there. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay, it was great value and Dorsett Regency will definitely be on the shortlist next time we visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay at the Dorsett Regency.”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the Dorsett Regency in Kennedy Town. From the moment I arrived, the staff were fantastic and very helpful. Everything in the room was virtually brand new - the decor and fittings were very cool. Very comfortable bed, excellent view out over the sea to the islands. Kennedy Town is only a ten minute taxi ride from Central and yet it has almost a village feel to it - not for long though, its about to get its own Metro station and that will likely change everything. In the meantime however, its an excellent location. Loved the hotel, loved the staff, loved the location. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in Kennedy Town”
Reviews.Author: HambleTrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed just prior to Chinese New year, decided to stay HK island side rather than Kowloon for a change and really enjoyed convenience of tram and taxis to areas of HK not previously explored. Room was ok size for HK & clean, decoration was a little quirky but a nice change from the standard corporate style rooms. Breakfast was included in my room rate and was average, the space in the restaurant is somewhat limited and seems a little disorganised with items stored in public areas. I used the shuttle bus on a couple of occasions to get to the city and the Airport express - recommend that you book to get a seat. There are a few bars close by if you don't want to travel far. Also the highest concentration of 24hr Convenience stores I think i have ever encountered there are probably 5 or 6 within 3 minutes of the hotel. Overall a nice stay, reasonable price - would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAngeDeMort
Reviews.Content: This hotel once again lives up to my expectations and quite a deal too. I had to return to Hong Kong on a very last minute trip staying from 23-26 January. However, during that time it was Chinese New Years and most of the hotels in HK are either fully booked or outrageously expensive. Luckily there was still a room availalble in Dorsett and at a very good deal from TripAdvisors which was 35% off with breakfast for a three night stay. The breakfast was very tasteful and the quality of the staff remains as professional and helpful as usual. Don't let the location of the hotel fool you, this hotel is worth every penny and they deliver more that expected. I will recommend this hotel to all business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectation! But Location just a little bit too far (just a little bit)”
Reviews.Author: greenbeanz
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and spacious. Wi-fi is free and fast!!! and free and fast!!! Unless you know your HK transport system, the location is just a little too far... Somehow managed to get by by taking the red minivans to/from Mongkok & Causeway Bay... super fast!!! Read about the MLC tour groups from other reviewers... I realized generally this is not a problem cos all of them want to get to their room fast and they will squeeze themselves into one lift... (Amazing, I know!) So you only have to wait for the next lift :)

Reviews.Title: “a good choice in HK”
Reviews.Author: XiaomingZhuang
Reviews.Content: We arrived in HK airport in Jan, 15. It was raining outside. We took Airport Express directly to Hongkong Station. Come out of the MRT station from A exit. You will find a Starbucks coffee, just outside of which is the place to wait for their shuttle bus, opposite of IFC(International Financial Centre). I didn't find their shuttle bus, so I called the hotel. They told me to wait there for 20 minutes. Then the shuttle bus came. It took only 15 to 20 minutes to the hotel. The lobby is a little bit disappointed, it is small and crowded. We reserved the deluxe room with seaview. They gave us a room in 29th floor. The room is pretty large and comfortable. Breakfast is also good and tasteful. Nearby community is typical hongkong ordinary livehood. There are several large supermarkets there, including P(百佳） and Wellcome（惠康). And also a lot of choices of local Cantonese food restaurants. We are quite satisfied with our choice and enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Check if the new MTR station has opened first!”
Reviews.Author: KelJack
Reviews.Content: The hotel was new, the room was excellent and the buffet breakfast was good. The provided a free shuttle bus to the MTR and Airport express stations, but this was only during the day (not after 8pm).The location is inconvenient to get home after this time (some taxi drivers refused to take us when we got out at the current closest MTR station), but will be fine when the new MTR station opens soon. Be wary of the cleanliness of the spa baths (although ours looked clean, when filled and spa jets turned on a significant number of foreign hairs appeared...).

Reviews.Title: “True Value”
Reviews.Author: ChinmayHota
Reviews.Content: I am a firm believer in the dictum, "You normally get what you pay for." Having found out the price range of Hong Kong hotels in the internet, I expected what I would get in this hotel. But my actual experience surpassed my expectation. First the hotel interior in its black and white motif was smart and stylish. It was spit and polish every inch of the hotel. Secondly, the Kennedy Street location was alright for me as I had gone purely for tourism purpose. The tram terminal was just three blocks away, and the experience in these slow moving conveyance is a must-do for Hong Kong visitors. The bus service, with plenty of them available, can be reached with a minute's walk. The place was surrounded by restaurants of all kinds. I felt very much at home with the Indian restaurant Clay Oven located two minutes' walk away. Then there are plenty of seven eleven type stories, fruit shops and many more. There is a lovely park half a kilometer away buzzing with morning activity. So location wise the hotel was great for me. The shuttle service of the hotel made the distance from city centre easy to negotiate. I found the driver of the shuttle smart, polite and helpful. I had got a harbour view room in the 28th floor. The view of the sea on one side with a docked cruise ship and a hill on the other side of my window made the look just stunning. The reception staff was polite, ready to help and guide with their free map of Kennedy Town. The lift opens to the restaurant directly which was a bit intriguing for me. More intriguing was the glass window between the living room and the toilet. When I discovered that a automatic button can lower a shade I was relieved. But I still do not understand the wisdom of placing the glass separator in the first place. I was very happy with the total ambiance of the hotel. The suitcase front model on the outside of each room gives the decor a very contemporary look.

Reviews.Title: “So So only”
Reviews.Author: glotraveller_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here and found out that whilst the room was small, it was clean. However breakfast left a lot to be desired in terms of choice. In addition, the dining room was small considering the size of the hotel, thus we had to stand around the lift area whilst waiting for the tables to be cleared. Although there was a free shuttle service (supposedly to Sheung Wan AND Central stations), we discovered that the bus doesn't stop at Sheung Wan. Therefore I wonder what would happen to those who wait at Sheung Wan to be picked up to go back to the hotel. As we went back to Central, we never found out. Secondly the shuttle bus used was a mini bus which meant that you had to book your slots ahead of time (we found that out on the 2nd day when we wanted to leave at 11am only to learn that the bus was full!). The hotel gets a lot of PRC Chinese tour groups (it seems) and there was a day when we returned to the hotel, the whole group literally occupied the whole lobby/reception area with people and bags littered all over. Overall, not a convenient location and whilst we were staying there, not a considerate clientele as this the room opposite ours were loud, waking us up every single day like an unwanted alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Douliketotravel
Reviews.Content: We came upon the Dorsett Regency when booking through an online website. What a great deal! The other reviews mentioned that it was a bit far out but we were in Hong Kong for a vacation so we were in no rush to get to the city center every day. The daily shuttle leaves every hour and drops you off in either 1 of 2 very central locations. So yes, although the metro is not nearby the hotel, we did not feel that getting around was a problem. And honestly, to take a taxi home from anywhere downtown was no more than $15USD. So we did not feel the location to be a hindrance. The rooms were small, but clean and to me that is the most important thing. The front desk was kind enough to upgrade us to a room with a an ocean view. We enjoyed the daily breakfast buffet, this was a plus. And we also want to say a big thank you to the dining room staff. Every morning, for some reason, there were some rude hotel guests that would just walk right into the dining room and seat themselves while ignoring the line of guests waiting to be seated. However, the dining staff would, in a very tactful way let them know that they needed to wait in line to be seated. (Maybe a suggestion to the hotel, please get one of those "Please wait to be seated" signs?) Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again if the price is right! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lenny37
Reviews.Content: Hotel located at western end of hong kong island at a residential area called kennedy town. The nearest mtr is sheung wan. Though not walking distance, the hotel provides a free shuttle to hong kong station by the hour. The bustop and tramstation to central is a mere 5mins walk away. Near the hotel you will find almost anything you need. Local food shops, restaurants, pacific coffee, 7-11, supermarket, laundry shop etc etc. Rooms are small but well appointed. My room has a view to the harbour and mountains. Bathroom has rainfall shower and good pressure. Housekeeping services efficient and clean. Front desk staff speak good english and helpful. Doorman friendly and gives good directions. Free breakfast was enough to start the day. I didnt eat there everyday. Near the hotel were many small food shops so i had tim sum, porriage and other local food. This is hongkong, you'll never run out of things to eat. Great place to stay seriously. Do not be tempted by the hotels near mtr at touristy places. The rooms are overpriced and small. In fact, i find it more convenient to travel by bus or tram. The mtr stations have so many exits and one can get lost or walk alot more if you use the wrong exit. The area near the mongkok jordan areas are extremely crowded. Look no further. Dorsett is the best choice, at least for now.

Reviews.Title: “Service is excellent !! Staff is just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Worldresident33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over the holidays at the Dorsett Regency in Hong Kong. It is located in Kennedy Town which is best described as the "China Town of Hong Kong". We loved it- it is real, great location to get almost anywhere. There are many very clean and affordable places to eat close by. The Dorsett is new hotel. The accommodations are Asian style which means that the rooms have all you need, but are not extravagant or large. These are very modern. However their best kept secret is there wonderful staff they are the one's who truly make the experience wonderful. Everyone is attentive, nice, cordial and most important, helpful. They will do anything for you, so please remember you are in Asia, so be mindful of their customs of interaction. Which include giving an item to another person using your two hands and bowing, not shaking hands. Hong Kong is a wonderfully organized & sophisticated city. The Dorset is centrally located & offers the extra bonus of free shuttles every hour. Including one that will take you to & from the Express Train that leads directly to the Airport. Allowing you to check into your flight at the train station, so you can travel in the train without hassle. When we go back we will return to the Dorsett Regency, we like how well they took care of us. We wish the Dorsett Regency a wonderful Chinese new year and may the year of the dragon bring them much hope and prosperity. From Atlanta, Ga

Reviews.Title: “Woaah, this is really far out of town (where's the cabs?)”
Reviews.Author: Kalamatta
Reviews.Content: Unless you're doing business in Kennedy Town (ie western tip of the island), there is really very little reason to be here. The building is one of those pencil thin new stick that got stuck incongruously between a old-style Hong kong bakery and the corner neighbourhood HSBC (yes, there's a HSBC on every street). You'll have to walk out to the (reclaimed) shore section (3 blocks) to get a taxi. If it's raining, all bets are off. Fight with the sharp elbowed local crowd to get on the minibuses (the only thing running)! Having said that if you don't plan to be out of the room, its a very artistic, neo-gaudy but overall pleasant room for the price - reasonably large in HK (of course small in every other part of the world save Tokyo). Lots of funky mirrors in the bathroom. Hans Grohe showerware (lovely). So there you have it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sn00ze11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our way to Bangkok. We found that the hotel is a little bit out of the way, but there is a shuttle bus available during the day. We enjoyed our one night stay there. Service was good, internet was good as well. Breakfast was very tasty. The rooms are a good size, very cute and modern decor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for couple”
Reviews.Author: pharmbear
Reviews.Content: good amenities, non-smoking, clean and well-maintaned interior. Free and fast WiFi, good for surfing and at work. Thanks to the checkin arrangement, the suite that we stayed had a great sea view which my wife and I enjoyed. Staff were very helpful, and prompt to help me with queries. Thanks to Jason for the helpful assistance when we wanted to extend our stay at DRHK. During checkout on 31 Dec 2011, we were very delighted by the helpful staff and driver who had helped us with the heavy baggage to the hotel shuttle, thanks. Not to mention other helpful staff that assisted us in one way or another during our one week stay in HK (e.g. the staff who had dropped by our room to help troubleshoot the weighing balance on the last night of our stay in HK). I look forward to your hospitality and great services on the next stay at DRHK.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: forestguard
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days last week, if you are using express train to hong kong station ( also IFC mall and central station are located ), the customer service or even the guard will tell you that no dorsett regency shuttle bus is available, you have to go up to the level of city check in area beside starbucks and go outside, the complimentary shuttle may arrive between 10:15 to 10:25 on an hourly basis until 8:25 pm. The hotel is located around 10 to 15 mins by bus, make sure to print the location map with address, most of the taxi drivers are not familiar with the hotel. It is in the residential area of Kennedy where you can find several wellcome groceries, cafe de coral and fairwood eateries. Must try the fish ball soup restaurant nearby, ask concierge. The check in was a breeze and request for higher floors was granted ( important: construction on going beside the hotel ). MTR nearby is still in progress. The design is modern but quite small, just enough to fit 2 persons in a standard room. We got 2 rooms for my family of 5, of which 3 are children. It is noticeable to have a very strong nice shower with an adequate exhaust ventilation and drain. The wifi is free and fast, thankful for that. The breakfast is complimentary but be wary of additional charges which they tried to on my 3rd day of stay. Thank you to Ms. Maggie Lam, Guest Relations Manager, who eventually granted our complimentary breakfast for 5 since the supervisor at the dining area told us on the first day we arrived that the breakfast is free and even asked us about the no. of diners and room nos. The concierge are friendly and thank you to Tom, the receptionist for extending our check out time to 6pm for 1 room only. They charged 1,000 HKD on your card for any incidental fees in which Christy, the receptionist, said they will revert it accordingly. We will come back if MTR is ready. Also some varieties for breakfast will go a long long way.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Time @ Dorsett Regency Kennedy Town”
Reviews.Author: fushiapop
Reviews.Content: Before my trip, i wrote in to the hotel management to check their actual location, direction to hotel from airport! The very next day, i reced email reply from Venssa Sit, she did a Great job, by sharing with me not only the direction to hotel, she also provide me their shuttle bus timing too :) i have an easy time getting to the hotel early morning! For the next 5days time at the hotel, breakfast was good, hotel staffs are very nice and helpful, i love their ipod/iphone station where i can play my songs directly and charge at the same time, bed is soft and i love their shower room!! super big shower head, shiok!!! Although its not near any MTR, which i believe its in the midst of building, it have no short of bus/trams which u can take directly to any any nearby MTR station. When i took taxi back to hotel from shopping areas, they do not have any difficulties finding the hotel too, hassle free!!! Will consider to stay the same hotel if i go back to HKK again! *thumbsup* I will go back

Reviews.Title: “Love our stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Letisha_tan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the premier room in 8 - 12 Dec 2011, we enjoyed my stay there. Firstly the room size is big and the design is unique and hip. And I was shocked to find that there is a tv in front of the bathtub, always thot only 5/6 stars hotel offered that. The bathroom is so spacious that there are two vanity basins. The rooms are clean and up to standard. Guess the bonus will be the good view of the harbour and high floor that they can offered. Although the location seem far from shopping area, the hotel provided shuttle service to bring us to the shopping area. If you ever needed a taxi, the hotel staff will fetch one for you. Good service rendered. Good hotel to recommend.. but hope the pool will be ready the next time i visit the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “A classy local choice - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Anja-Superlekker
Reviews.Content: I pre-booked through Agoda a few weeks prior to my stay and got three nights in a superior room for a good price. I agree with previous posters that not many people know this hotel, and arriving from the airport was a little tricky, however, the Airport Express Bus A10 stops right outside the hotel. When I arrived well after 22.00, the welcome was very friendly, and my room on the 28th floor with a city view ( and a huge bay window to sit in) was stunning! Who cares that the rooms are tiny, the beds are tiny and that there is a glass wall between the bedroom and the toilet? It may be slightly problematic if you are sharing rooms as friends but otherwise, the room for me was to sleep in comfort, and sleep in comfort I did! The hotel appears brand new, with comfortable beds, lovely powerful showers, clean bathrooms and altogether comfortable rooms. The decor is somewhat flamboyant and kitschy (padded walls, plastic chandeliers and plenty of crazy mosaic tiles), and one wonders which wannabe interior designer has been let loose here, but it does not impede on comfort at all. The area the hotel is in is a friendly well-to-do area with not many tourists yet bus stops and tram are just around the corner, barely a minute's walk, there is a decent Chinese diner around the corner and a 24h Mc Donalds for late arrivals, and some very local shops and the ubiquitous convenience stores, too. The hotel also has a free shuttle bus into Central. Reception is friendly and very helpful (although not always accurate although this may have more to do that Seibu Loft has not bothered to update their stores on the internet yet) and they will go out of their way to help you finding your way around. I would definitely stay here again, a great choice in busy and expensive Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “HELPFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: tom_ume
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights in December.During my stay the guests next door were making a lot of noise at night till 1am by leaving the door wide open. I requested a change of room the next day and was attended by Ms Suki. She promptly arranged for a change of room. Mr Taori the front office staff also helped me locate the nearest 24-hr medical centre at 2.00am and even called the hospital to check if there was a doctor on duty at Pok Fu Lam before redirecting me to another hospital at Happy Valley. The staff at Dorsett were very helpful in rendering assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: little_ostow
Reviews.Content: My usual favourite JJ Hotel in Wanchai was booked out and I was forced to come up with a replacement and I was very happy with this find. Took advantage of a special deal and stayed 6 nights. Checking in was smooth and quick, at the same time, I was given the password for the free Wifi. My room at the corner on the 9th floor was spacious by HK standard, with ample space for luggage and shopping, it overlooks neighbouring apartments but heavy drape addressed the privacy issue. The only noise issue came from hotel guests out at the corridor, there were no traffic noise at all from where I was, which was nice. The room is on a non-smoking floor but I found an astray in the room, wonder what message is the hotel trying to give? Anyway, it is nice to be in a room that doesn't stink of cigarette or moldy smell. I should note that the hotel opened in August so all the amenities are still in a good condition. The bed was quite comfortable, the linen felt good when rubbing against my skin and extra pillow delivered promptly upon request. The bedside and in-room lighting was good and the air conditioner does not blow directly onto the bed, making sleep very comfortable. The bathroom small but bright, was quite clean and comes with amenities such as hair dryer, tooth brush, comb and cotton bud. The only complain I have is the shower door doesn't do its job to prevent water from flowing out to the floor, leaving the floor drench each time I use the shower. Extra hooks for towels would be nice too. The wardrobe is small but has enough hangers and a handy in-room safe. The bar fridge was too warm and I did not use it for the duration of my stay, I should also note that the fridge was not noisy at all. Having lived in Kennedy Town, it was easy to figure out the public transports. Taxi from Central is approximately HKD30 and buses with terminus at Kennedy Town (notably no. 5) costing HKD3.50 to HKD6 from Causeway Bay, making Kennedy Town quite a convenient location. Kennedy Town is also a terminus for HK Tram, costing HKD2.20 per ride, the last stop is just 3 minutes walk to the hotel. To get across the Western Tunnel to Kowloon's Tsim Sha Tsui East, Mongkok and Jordan area, take the 906 'Lai Chi Kok' bus. There are also countless mini buses serving Kennedy Town from Causeway Bay, Mongkok and Aberdeen. The neighbourhood is local but friendly, the shops open till late and a couple of convenient stores that opens 24/7 nearby. A good restaurant for yum cha on Catchick Street called Kueng Fatt should be tried out, for those who fancy a Western feed, the water front end of Davis Street should be able to accommodate, or head to Percy, a deli opened by an Aussie, also on Catchick Street for good Western take aways.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: byjing0h
Reviews.Content: Check in was very prompt and the rooms are clean, confortable, well-equipped and of reasonable size. The hotel is relatively new so all furniture and fittings are also in good condition. There is a glass window between the room and the shower/toilet. I’m not sure what purpose it serves but there also is an electronically operated partition that can be drawn over the window by those who may want some privacy. The fridge was not switched on but that was promptly attended to by the room attendant. The breakfast menu does not change a lot from day to day but the food is of good quality. Free in-room Wifi is available and paid printing and copying services are provided at reception. There are plenty of convenience shops and eating houses (including McDonalds and Subway) surrounding the hotel. The hotel’s website should be clearer about exactly where the shuttle picks up from at Hong Kong Central station. I took the Airport express train and followed the signs at HK Central station that pointed to the free hotel shuttles. It so happens that the Dorsett Regency is not one of the hotels serviced by those shuttles. The Dorsett has its own shuttle that collects passengers from outside the HK Central station’s airport check-in counter. (Yes, passengers flying out of HK can check their luggage in at HK Central station). I eventually got into a taxi and found that the driver did not speak any English. I kept saying Davis St (hotel location) and showed him the hotel address. He kept repeating what I said as Daisy St –until I gave him the hotel’s phone number. He then rang the hotel and took me there within about ten minutes. The taxi from KH Central to the hotel was HK$50. That includes a $5 surcharge for each large item of luggage. The hotel shuttle is a white mini bus and as it has no livery it can be hard to notice the first time around. A sign on the front passenger side windscreen has the name of the hotel. On one occasion the sign was upside down. The shuttle’s last pickup from HK central is 8.25 pm daily. The hotel does provide a very handy printout of the bus stops and services to and from its vicinity. A bus trip (Number 5x, 5B or 10) from HK Central is $4.40. A prepaid Octopus travel card is the best option for getting around on Kong Kong’s excellent bus/train public transport system. You can buy it on arrival at the airport and return it when you depart. Any unused credit will be returned to you less a $7 processing fee. You can also buy an Airport Express return pass that gives you a return trip to/from the Airport to HK Central or Kowloon stations and upto 3 days unlimited travel on the train (MTR) network only. It costs HK $300 and includes a $50 deposit that you get back. You may use the same pass for bus travel also but only if you top it up for bus travel first. You can do that at most convenience stores. Compared to many other HK hotels the Dorsett Regency is a little out of the way. But if you use the free shuttle service and/or the cheap and efficient public transport the location will not be a problem. I found the hotel staff to be extremely attentive and efficient and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: quirky76
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little boutique hotel, excellent service, clean and beautifully furnished . The location is fine and 5 min taxi from central Great little boutique which probably should be a mr&mrs smith hotel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Best value for money in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: Lana1984
Reviews.Content: After finally finding an affordable hotel in hong kong i must say the dorsett regency blew our minds. We have stayed in some of the worlds best hotels but what we got here can easily compete with all of them. Upon arrival at 2am we got an upgrade to a premium room, which was amazing! Windows on two sides of the room, overlooking the sea and mountains of hong kong. Jacuzzi and rainshower with a window facing the room and the view! Technological wise the hotel has a great and modern standard! Ihome system, nice sony flat screen with plenty of channels and great lightning in the room, controlable over switches, ipad n notebook rental service and also a shuttle to central. Cant really tell how goood the location is as we re only on a stop over n took the taxi from the airport! (300 hkd) Further the breakfast buffet is great. This hotel is highly recommendable n if they keep up like this it soon will be one of the best and most affordable adresses in hk! Defenetly recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: anniviers
Reviews.Content: We are currently enjoying a 7 night stay at the Dorsett Regency. At first glance, the area didn't seem very appealing, but now we love being in the middle of an old area of Hong Kong. Enjoyed watcing the locals fishing down at the waterfront at night and watching a group doing Tai-chi in Belcher Park in the morning. The hotel is only a short taxi ride away from Central Station and the Star Ferry (taxis here are inexpensive) and the hotel offers a regular free shuttle bus which is really useful. Lots of good local restaurants (we had Japanese tonight) and several places on Davis Street itself if you just fancy a drink. The decor of the hotel is very young and modern and although it has over 30 floors, it feels more like a small boutique hotel. The rooms have everything you need and are spotless. We asked for a high floor and a harbour view and I think we've had exceptional value for our money. Staff are really helpful - special thanks to Maggie who sorted out a new room for us when we didn't get the room we requested on arrival, and also to Alan, who helped us find out how to collect concert tickets. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: DrKarenProwse
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful from the moment we arrived. as i was physically ill upon arrival the staff, special mention to Tom and Maggie, organised for me to see a highly trained GP within two hours of our arrival who spoke fluent English and was considered one of the most highly regarded and educated doctors in hong kong. It was touching that Tom walked us to the doctor's surgery and conveyed to the medical staff my physical condition and treatment needs to expedite the process. breakfast every morning was sensational with a great array of local and continental options and a really good staff member who cooks amazingly delicious eggs. Cellini's restaurant (part of the hotel) excelled all expectations with very reasonably priced meals (eg three courses and tasters for a total of about $24 AUD). Service was exceptional and nothing was too much trouble. special mention to the young girl who very recently completed her traineeship and served our table with such professionalism often only seen in people who have worked for several years in hospitality. Hilbert said his goodbyes the day before we left as he was not on duty the day of our departure. The hotel had a feel of the vibe of Melbourne, Australia. Stunning views of the water, first class room and facilities and exceptional reasonable rates. great location with numerous specialty shops, hairdressers, reflexology within a five minute radius. the hotel is around 30 minutes from the international and domestic airports making it an easeful, inexpensive and relaxing journey to and from the airport and the hotel. Dr Karen Prowse and Vanessa O'Connell

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a Hong Kong stay”
Reviews.Author: andye10000
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2pm after an overnight flight to find that our room wasn't ready, not very happy but eventually we were upgraded to a spa room. From then on our stay was great - quiet room, big bed (very firm) ,good showers, high quality fittings and staff who couldn't do enough to help us. The room was bigger than we expected for HK and the breakfast buffet was very good - really set us up for the day. Yes it is a bit far out, (it'll be great when the MTR gets out there) but we made use of the hotel shuttle bus to get to Central, and then the trams on the way home. Little restaurants around the hotel, we enjoyed a nice chinese, a thai and then a great wee pub meal on our three nights there. We definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: kungfupandaMumbai
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely impressed by the comfortable and luxurious experience that this hotel offered me at the exceptionally reasonable price. The service was excellent, the breakfast was delicious and offered many options and the rooms also had free wi-fi. The way that the rooms are designed are also very remarkable, it involves a perfectly optimal utilisation of space - special mention for the awesome showers in the bathroom! The staff is extremely helpful and warm - I had a stellar experience here!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAngeDeMort
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for cost conscious business travelers looking for great service for a reasonable price. Being a business traveler, the location of the hotel and cost of the room is very important. After searching on the web, I found the Dorsett Regency hotel and decided to give it a shot after learning that they are newly established hotel. Even thought the hotel is located a little farther from the business district of Central and Admiralty, the hotel offered complimentary shuttle bus services to strategic locations in Hong Kong making it very convenient. The room itself is very clean and modern with complimentary internet access for me to get work done in my room. I would like to compliment on the front desk and concierge team were exceptionally helpful and attentive during my stay. After my laptop suffered a system failure, they conveniently offered their iPad rental service (with charge) so that I can continue to send important email back to my office in the states. Overall, my stay at this hotel was phenomenal for the price I paid per night. I hope they can keep it up and I don’t returning.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis away from the huzzle & buzzle”
Reviews.Author: Danster123
Reviews.Content: I spend 2 nights in this brand new hotel during it's pre-opening phrase for my business trip in Hong Kong during August and the first thing I received when I enter this hotel, was greeted with a big smile from the doors men. The check-in was speedy and the front desk staffs were very friendly and helpful. The staff when out of the way to get me a taxi when I miss the shuttle bus was just something that you wouldn't expect and that is the kind of services I got from them. The room I stay in is very trendy and the design is very modernistic that fit perfectly with the office chair in front of the desk. I was also able to charge my ipad on their iphone/ipad dock in the room. The shower is simply the best I have ever encountered. The super-large overhead shower head is a delight to use and the overall design of the shower area gave a very luxurious feel to the whole experience. It was acceptable that the pool and the restaurant weren't open yet, but if the next time I come back to Hong Kong, I will be sure to try that out when they are open. This hotel is away from the huzzle and buzzle of Hong Kong and it's very quiet and made me feel I am at home. It’s the little things about this hotel than made it stand out differently from my other visit in Hong Kong. I would definitely return for my business trip as it’s only 10 minutes away from Central from their shuttle bus.

HotelInfo.Name: Dorsett Regency Hotel Hong Kong
HotelInfo.Address: No.18 Davis Street, Kennedy Town, Hong Kong, China
